result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Micah E Glenn

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Micah E Glenn in court.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer appeared by video for Micah E Glenn.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew Westphal in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing.  Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant. Case adjourned for status of counsel hearing in PE.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

State motions that case be calendared to follow case #22CF3153 and that the previous State V. Lee Hearing be canceled. Court grants the motion.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Micah E Glenn in court in person.  Prosecuting attorney Nicolas Heitman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report, filed.

Defendant Micah E Glenn in court by audio.  Matthew Westphal appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD needs more information from Mr. Glenn to determine his eligibility. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 7/14/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Oral No Contact Order with DMH

Defendant Micah E Glenn in court with Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge  Franke, Branch 25.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on July 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Micah E Glenn in court.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
He did check in to court at 1:15 p.m. on 6/30/2022, no file was in CCAP. He was sent to Rm. 405 the DA's office. The case was entered in later on in the day. New court date will be schedule. Notice will be mailed out.  Initial appearance scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6/30/22 @ 1:30p
